findings.title: Integer overflow and underflow in burn(), burnFrom() and mintToken() functions
findings.description: The burn(), burnFrom(), and mintToken() functions are vulnerable to integer overflow and underflow due to incorrect arithmetic operations, which can lead to unexpected behavior. It is recommended to use safe math operations and check function parameters with require statements.

findings.title: Potential unauthorized value in total supply and target account balance due to negative input in mintToken function
findings.description: In the mintToken function, if owner passes a negative value, it can lead to unexpected values in total supply and in balance of target account.

findings.title: Test case failing to revert when owner sends negative tokens to mintToken() function
findings.description: In mintToken function if owner passes a negative value, it can lead to unexpected value in total supply and in balance of target account.

findings.title: Test case failing to revert when someone sends 0 tokens in transfer functions
findings.description: The contract does not properly handle zero token transfers in its transfer functions, which can lead to unexpected behavior.

findings.title: Integer OverFlow and Underflow
findings.description: Using unsafe math operations can lead to integer overflow and underflow in burn(), burnFrom(), and mintToken() functions.
